sentences.en: A goad, as for prodding cattle.
sentences.cn: 刺棒赶牲畜用的尖头棒.

sentences.en: A slight goad or incentive; a small stimulus.
sentences.cn: 刺激小刺激或激励; 小刺激.

sentences.en: Computer simulation showed that such a method achieved goad recognition effect.
sentences.cn: 计算机仿真实验表明,该方法取得了较好的识别效果.

sentences.en: Ellie uses wit as a goad to try to force people to see what is in front of them.
sentences.cn: 埃莉运用自己的机智风趣启发人们，努力使他们看清眼前的东西。

sentences.en: He needed to goad the mage into acting rashly.
sentences.cn: 他需要刺激这位法师,使他自乱阵脚.

sentences.en: He wondered if the psychiatrist was trying to goad him into some unguarded response.
sentences.cn: 他怀疑那位精神科医生试图刺激他作出一些本能的反应。

sentences.en: His opposition acted as a goad to her determination to succeed.
sentences.cn: 他的反对反而刺激她坚定了取得成功的决心。

sentences.en: Hunger goad him to steal a loaf of bread.
sentences.cn: 饥饿驱迫他偷一块面包.

sentences.en: One that acts as a provocative stimulus; a goad.
sentences.cn: 刺激令人振奋的刺激物; 激励.

sentences.en: Some people think the year of Goad is a jinx.
sentences.cn: 人们普遍认为羊年不吉利.

sentences.en: The offer of economic aid was a goad to political change.
sentences.cn: 提供经济援助是政治改革的推动力。

sentences.en: The writer said he needed some goad because he was indolent.
sentences.cn: 这个作家说他需要刺激,因为他很懒惰.

sentences.en: They needed the goad of threatened fines to make them take action.
sentences.cn: 他们需要罚款威胁的刺激来使他们采取行动.

sentences.en: To live to eat is not a goad attitude toward life.
sentences.cn: 活着就是为了吃不是好的生活态度.

sentences.en: To urge or goad to action.

sentences.cn: 这个问题很多新人都会关心的!

words.tran_cn: 刺激；（赶牲口用的）刺棒；激励

trans.tran_cn: 赶牲口的尖棒，激励，刺激
trans.tran_en: something that forces someone to do something
If you goad someone, you deliberately make them feel angry or irritated, often causing them to react by doing something

trans.tran_cn: 刺激，激励，（用尖棒）驱赶，驱使（或怂恿、刺激）某人
